verbose_text: In a study comparing the expression of leptin and adiponectin in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (122 patients) and normal esophageal mucosa (40 subjects) Duan et al. found that also in esophageal carcinoma there occurs imbalanced expression of adipocytokines and a link of lymph node metastasis and/or tumor stage with expression of leptin and adiponectin, which may have potential significance in carcinogenesis and poor outcomes [XREF_BIBR].
